text.__SUMMARY__: Fritillaria meleagroides is a Eurasian species of bulb-forming plants in the lily family, native to Xinjiang, Russia (Altay Krai, Western Siberia Krai, European Russia, North Caucasus), Kazakhstan, Ukraine, and Bulgaria.Fritillaria meleagroides is a bulb-producing perennial up to 40 cm tall. Leaves are linear, alternate, up to 15 cm long. Flowers are nodding (hanging), bell-shaped, dark purple or brownish-purple.
